Class Engine

java.lang.Object
simu.framework.Engine
Direct Known Subclasses:
MyEngine
public abstract class Engine extends Object
The Engine class is an abstract class that provides the core functionality for running a simulation. It manages the event list, simulation time, and the state of the simulation (running, paused, stopped).

  • Method Details

    • setSimulationTime

      public void setSimulationTime(double time)
      Sets the simulation time.
      Parameters:
      time - the simulation time

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs the simulation. It resets variables, initializes the simulation, and processes events. The simulation runs until it is stopped or the simulation time is reached.

    • simulate

      public boolean simulate()
      Checks if the simulation should continue running.
      Returns:
      true if the simulation should continue, false otherwise

    • runEvent

      protected abstract void runEvent(Event t)
      Runs the specified event.
      Parameters:
      t - the event to run

    • tryCEvents

      protected abstract void tryCEvents()
      Tries to run C-phase events.

    • initialize

      protected abstract void initialize()
      Initializes the simulation.

    • results

      protected abstract void results()
      Processes the results of the simulation.

      Starts the simulation.

      public void stopSimulation()
      Stops the simulation.

      public abstract void resetVariables()
      Resets the simulation variables.

      public boolean isRunning()

      true if the simulation is running, false otherwise
